page.title: 05ARMY CAMP AT BUDDON
page.content:
Soldiering-a different lifestyle
{Barry Buddon}is a sandy spit of 3000 acres.The land belonged to Lord Panmure who sold it to the War Office now{Ministry of Defence}in 1896. At Barry there are 21 firing ranges where annually up to 33000 soldiers from all regiments are trained to use various weapons.The infantry soldiers practise on 12 ranges at any one time 311 days of the year.Red flags fly at shooting times.Parachuting jumps are practised. 21 civilians are employed at the camp. The area is slowly being eroded by the sea and a wall is being built in an attempt to stop this.On the dunes grow some silver birches,fir and pine trees.These have altered slightly the windswept character of this area of marshes and dunes.
